pkgmetadata.longdescription: Save====A very simple module to *safely* save data to files in python.When you choose a path and a name for the file you want to save yourdata to, the script checks **if the given file at the given path alreadyexist**; if so, **it adds an increasing numbering at the end of the filename** (just before the file extension if there is any) untill it findsa path+name not taken already.This prevents from losing data by inadvertently re-writing a file.Install-------``$ pip install save``Basic usage-----------:: from save import save data = 'Hey there' save(data, 'my_file.txt')The safe\_path function-----------------------You can import the ``safe_path`` submodule to use with other librariesor functions. It provides the same functionality as ``save()``.(Basically the ``save()`` function itself calls ``safe_path()`` to dothe work)This is an example involving matplotlib::: from matplotlib import pyplot as plt from save import safe_path plt.plot(range(10)) plt.savefig(safe_path('my_figure.png'))
